basics.name: Bakary Coulibaly
basics.label: Electrical & Computer Engineer
basics.summary: M.S. Electrical Engineering student specializing in renewable energy and AI-driven photovoltaic defect detection.

work.name: Institute for Security and Conflict Studies - GWU
work.summary: Facilitated seminar courses for the US Department of Defense's Foreign Area Officers, compiling French resources and assisting in syllabus development.

work.name: Heat Transfer and Alternative Energy Systems Group - NIST
work.summary: Conducted research and development in PV module testing, solar simulator lab renovation, and water heating technology evaluations, improving data analysis and testing efficiency.

work.name: IT Service Desk - Montgomery College
work.summary: Provided IT support during Montgomery College's transition to remote operations amid the COVID-19 pandemic, resolving technical issues and optimizing efficiency.

work.name: Montgomery College
work.position: Learning Assistant (Principles of Chemistry I & Precalculus)
work.summary: Led review sessions and employed remote teaching tools, resulting in a 100% passing rate under faculty mentorship.

projects.name: AutoGrow
projects.summary: Designed, prototyped, and implemented an off-grid automated gardening system with a 100W solar panel and 12V battery.
highlights: Designed custom PCB and integrated ESP32 microcontroller.
Implemented Micropython for low power soil moisture sensing and solenoid control.
Developed UI components using Dart and Flutter.

projects.name: NIST: Testing Photovoltaic Modules
projects.summary: Conducted PV module testing, EL imaging, and co-authored an ongoing research paper.
highlights: Developed Python scripts for automated EL image analysis, reducing processing time by 50%.
Tested 20+ solar panels for degradation analysis.
